word: The example of this holy man should be a lesson to all the people of God, that they are not only to pray in faith but to work with wise diligence and fidelity. How many difficulties we encounter, and how we hinder the working of Providence on our behalf, because prudence, forethought, and painstaking are regarded as having little to do with religion. . . . Careful consideration and well-matured plans are as essential to the success of sacred enterprises today as in the time of Nehemiah. . . .
